result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Will Gresl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
If 90 day sentence needs to be imposed, the Court grants Huber privileges pursuant to 303.08 Stats. or treatment ONLY.Court DOES NOT OBJECT to electronic monitoring.  Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Pilot Program.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*If 90 days shall be imposed, The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. or treatment ONLY: Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Pay supervision fees.
*Any other programs deemed appropriate by the agent.
.
Defendant is not eligible for the Pilot Program.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample, PLUS DNA surcharge but inclusive of all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and to convert to civil judgment if unpaid during the period of probation.
.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of INITIAL APPEARANCE commencing FEBRUARY 20, 2015 received and filed. (7 Pages.)

from State of Wisconsin Department of Correction, received and filed. lms
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/28/14. AR

Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Hanna R. Kolberg for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Gary G.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 23 days
days time served.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of
18 months with the following conditions:
*If 90 days shall be imposed, The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. or treatment ONLY: Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Pay supervision fees.
*Any other programs deemed appropriate by the agent.
.
Defendant is not eligible for the Pilot Program.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample, PLUS DNA surcharge but inclusive of all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and to convert to civil judgment if unpaid during the period of probation.
.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

Justice Point Program report dated July 23, 2014; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defense counsel withdraws their motion.   Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Joshua Will Gresl not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Court hears bail arguments but needs additional information.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Letter dated 3/7/14.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in custody.  Step Nolten for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Joshua Will Gresl in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
